text.front:
arXiv:0908.3520v1 [astro-ph.CO]
25 Aug 2009
Astron. Nachr. / AN 999, No. 88, 789 -791 (2006)
/ DOI please set DOI!
A composite K-band Luminosity Function for Cluster Galaxies
R. De Propris 1,⋆ and D. Christlein 2
1 Cerro Tololo Inter-American Observatory,
La Serena, Chile
2 Max Planck Institute for Astrophysics,
Garching, Germany
The dates of receipt and acceptance should be inserted later
Key words Galaxies: luminosity function, mass function
We present a composite K-band luminosity function for 10 clusters at low redshift, where member galaxies are identified
from an existing spectroscopic survey (the 2dF galaxy redshift survey). Our kinematically selected K-band luminosity
function is well fitted by a Schechter function with M *
K = −24.50 + 5 log h and α = −0.98 over −27 << MK −
5 log h < −22. This is very similar to the 2dF field value and suggests that the integrated mass accretion history of
galaxies does not vary strongly with environment
